text:
Most of my wardrobe is Lulu because they have clothing and apparel for any occasion. For me, comfort & convenience is priority, whether working out or going out for the evening. I haven't purchased a pair of jeans, "slacks", dress shirts, or even blazers by any other brands in well over a decade because I know I can rely on high quality merch that's easy to wear & will last long. With such a selection, I've continued to refresh my look with ABC pants, seasonal tops, and workout gear, knowing I'll have the same comfort & fits. With plenty of styles, colors, and materials to choose from, it's easy to keep my style fresh every time I add a new piece.
The Robson location is the only store I ever shop in the flesh because I can just as easily follow the "We Made Too Much" category online for sales on different colors & materials of what I know will fit already, plus lots of bonus Aeroplan points!
At this location, it really seems like each staff member enjoy their jobs. I don't think they could fake their consistently exceptional customer service! The occasions I go in alone, the staff are always flying around helping with sizes, etc... So what I appreciate the most in this store are the honest opinions from whoever is helping me in the fitting room area. If it doesn't look right, they will come up with another option, but when they give me a green light, I can feel confident with my purchases. Their return/exchange policies for members are the easiest I've experienced. Their turn around time with alterations is never more than five days, & often less. It's an uplifting, above & beyond experience, from their greeters to the tillüëåüòä

Today, my wanderings took me to a place I don't usually go .
Lululemon.
Yeah, I know.
Me, a guy who's practically colorblind and has zero patience for shopping, stepping into the world of athletic wear. My mission? A few shirts.
My usual experience in these places? A test of endurance.
My eyes glazing over different shades of light green and light blue.
ready to just find a quiet corner somewhere. And that‚Äôs when Natalie ask me if I need any help .
I think she saw the quiet frustration in my eyes .
The unspoken plea of a man who just wanted to buy some damn shirts and get out.
She moved with the precision of a seasoned guide, pulling options, getting the colors right and done .
before I could even fully register what was happening.
In and out.
A surgical strike. Natalie, you're a godsend.
You made what I expected to be a chore into a surprisingly pleasant experience.
So, if you find yourself at Lululemon, and you're not entirely sure where to begin, seek out Natali.
I will return that‚Äôs for sure.

Yesterday, I made a large purchase at the flagship store. The cashier, an Asian female employee with glasses and medium-length hair, showed a very impatient attitude throughout the checkout process. After completing the payment, she did not fold the clothes and simply handed me the receipt without any care.

This was by far the worst experience I have ever had at Lululemon.

I was really disappointed with my experience at this location.

The staff member who assisted me treated customers inconsistently. The customer before me asked if there were other color options for the shopping bag, and the staff member provided a shopping bag at no charge. However, when it was my turn, I was told that the shopping bag normally provided with a purchase would cost $2.

I couldn‚Äôt help but feel that customers were being treated differently, which was upsetting. I specifically visited this location, so this experience was especially disappointing.

Customer service should be consistent and fair. Unfortunately, after this visit, I don‚Äôt think I‚Äôll be returning to this location and will choose a different store instead.

Lulu Lemon üçã is a a really good active brand for women in the athletic department and just every day general wear. Although I must say that I defend Chip Wilson Collections because he is the owner and the maker of this company but also stuff being sold should go his way as he is the rightful person of Ownership. His collections were truly the best and also the most comfortable in Canada. I believe his products should be back on the shelves because from a female perspective his products were attractive, appealing and comfortable for woman who can actively move everyday.

store_name: Lululemon Georgia Street Pacific Centre Vancouver
text: The customer service was excellent; Majo helped me find a warm sweater to keep me cozy. She listened to what I needed and picked out a couple of pieces for me to try. It was a fantastic shopping experience with her assistance.

store_name: Lululemon Georgia Street Pacific Centre Vancouver
text:
Exceptional service - Franklin and Gracia.

Went above and beyond, grabbed items from the mannequin for me. Helped me pick out the T-shirt as well (they all look the same to me lmao, but the fabrics are different which is important when selecting for your needs - thank you for the assistance).

Ended up purchasing 7" shorts from Alo and 5" shorts from Lululemon. Lululemon culture/and QC was significantly better. After checking the items at home, quality and consistency was SIGNIFICANTLY better at Lululemon.

I had wanted to check Alo (currently privately held company, could potentially look to go public to scale IMO), to see if the rumors regarding their effort and respect were justified. I was shocked. You have to do due diligence when shopping at Alo, (or just purchase from Lululemon IMO). I had asked for a specific color that they "had in the back", I came home and noticed a pin through the fabric, and the Alo tag marked up - which I should have checked). Unacceptable, especially for shorts over $100.

Lululemon was impressive. Not the same experience at Alo. First time there, no relation to the companies. Not a Lululemon shareholder (although I might consider it now lmao), or ever was.

store_name: Lululemon Georgia Street Pacific Centre Vancouver
text:
Absolutely ridiculous experience at Lululemon. One pant leg is a full 2 inches longer than the other!

I reached out for support after just a few weeks of owning them, and here‚Äôs the response they hit me with:

‚ÄúBased on the photos provided, your product is not showing any signs of any quality issues or defects‚Ä¶‚Äù

Excuse me? Two pant legs not matching is apparently normal now?

Safe to say I won‚Äôt be shopping here again.

Future shoppers: bring a measuring tape with you unless you want to DIY tailor your overpriced athleisure.

store_name: Lululemon Georgia Street Pacific Centre Vancouver
text:
On January 14th I was at your Pacific Centre location with my wife and young son. I normally shop at your Burrard location.

I walked in and tried to look around on my own. There were two staff members, but instead of helping customers they were chatting with each other and trying things on in front of the mirror. We didn‚Äôt even hear a simple ‚Äúhello‚Äù or ‚Äúwelcome.‚Äù They just kept talking to each other.

I was there at around 4:14 PM and since no one paid attention to us, we left and went to the Burrard location instead.

It‚Äôs the same brand but two completely different customer service experiences. Burrard staff are amazing and very attentive, but this location doesn‚Äôt reflect Lululemon at all actually, it felt like there was no customer service.

store_name: Lululemon Georgia Street Pacific Centre Vancouver
text:
On December 6, 2025 when I went to make an exchange at the Pacific Centre location, the educator who assisted me was very rude and displayed poor customer service. I understand she may be experiencing something in her personal life, but professionalism is still important while at work.
Educator ID: 99994000212606
Register: 2

They claim this is the first Lululemon store opened by Chip Wilson, but honestly, it doesn‚Äôt feel like it. If it‚Äôs truly such an important and historic location for the brand, you would expect it to be designed and presented in a way that reflects that significance ‚Äî something unique or memorable.

The store layout is also a bit strange. There are two completely separate sections for men and women, connected only by a narrow corridor. The men‚Äôs section is noticeably smaller and feels like an afterthought, with very limited product selection and almost no variety.

Overall, I didn‚Äôt enjoy visiting this branch. If you‚Äôre looking for a wide range of items or a more special experience, this location might not be worth the trip.

It seems that the return and exchange policies differ between the Robson store and the Kitsilano store.

I came here a few weeks after purchasing 13 items to return two of them. They kept insisting that a refund was not possible, and that even store credit on a gift card could not be given. It honestly felt like no one really understood the return policy, and the explanation I was given was unclear and inconsistent.

They told me that only a size exchange was possible. While checking the item, I noticed hair and dust on it, so I asked the staff member standing there (wearing glasses with braided hair) if there was another new item available. She looked at me like I was being unreasonable and repeatedly said that it was a new item. I already know it was supposed to be new, but seeing hair and dust on it made me uncomfortable.

While she went to the back, I could see other staff members looking at me, and it felt very unpleasant and unprofessional. The whole interaction made me feel uncomfortable and disrespected.

After that, I went to the Robson store, where I was able to exchange my size, receive product recommendations, and get my refund as store credit on a gift card without any issues.

I will not be returning to this location.

Just don't buy items. They do not guarantee to look into the quality after 1 year of purchasing the product. This purse was mainly in my closet and started pealing off. Came to the store for them to bring to quality control and was told that they do not do that if item pass the one year mark - New policy. BUYER BEWARE!

I'm a huge lululemon fan and this was the first store that I ever went to when it to when it opened way back! I always enjoy visiting this store on my trips to Vancouver! On my visit yesterday at about 11:00, all the employees were so incredibly helpful and pleasant! I can't remember all the name except for Cora (spelling?) who was Irish and telling me about the Dublin Marathon! Great chat with all the employees and made a fantastic experience! Purchased multiple new things including a new puffer jacket and I absolutely believe lululemon has the overall best running gear out there for all my training runs and races!

The only lululemon location I‚Äôll visit!! As an avid lululemon-wearer and fitness instructor, I spend more time than I would care to admit in this store, and I have always loved my visits at lululemon West 4th. The staff is always ready to help, providing ideas, insights, sizes, colours and styles for your needs, and make everyone feel welcomed. Team members Parker and Clara have always made my visits unique, with their masterful customer service, kindness, care and attention to detail. Even at the sake of convenience, I will wait and do my shopping at the West 4th location. The layout and size of the store allows for ease, and doesn‚Äôt cause claustrophobia during busy hours, but rather flows effortlessly from the start to end of your shopping experience.
Very helpful staff lots of inventory and sizes available. Clean and organized change rooms, good clearance sale rack always at  the back, line up moved quickly and counter staff were very kind

Boxing Day was crazy but all the staff did amazing! It was a hot, cramped store and the lineup was long - but thankfully there was an employee helping with organizing the winding check out line. (Props to her! Amazing job keeping everyone in line, and in order. üëèüèª ) The lineup moved quickly as well.

Great job everyone!! üòä

Jamal was super helpful! Even holding up pants to help decide what fit I was looking for, for my husband. Engaged with us almost immediately and was jist overall a friendly staff member.  Liked his style as well! Great customer service!

I had such a great shopping experience thanks to Anne! She was incredibly kind and helpful from the moment I walked in. Anne helped me find the right sizes, suggested styles that suited me perfectly, and made sure I found pieces I absolutely loved. Her attention to detail and warm attitude made the whole experience enjoyable and stress-free. Thank you, Anne, for your amazing service. You truly made my day!

Lululemon Sweat Collective Program Sucks & Rules/Policy Truly Sucks For Me Because I really really truly wanted one specific sports bra so badly since that my friend Naomi is a member at Lululemon & gets at 25% off discount for herself & personal use only but that is not what my friend Naomi has told me about it yesterday on Monday January 5th , she said that she is a member & told me to tell you on which items or item that I want & she said that she'll buy it for me & I pay her back via e transfer. I just really really truly wish that I can be a member too but unfortunately I am not a instructor, athlete, nurse or anything like that so Unfortunately I can't apply for it.

We visited this location today to buy some shirts for our son. We were warmly greeted by a representative Allie, she provided an excellent customer service. Allie was very professional,  knowledgeable,  gave us best options to buy T shirts for our son. She convinced us within 10 min to buy shirts. In my opinion,  her performance was outstanding. Thanks to store manager for hiring an excellent customer service representative. We will visit again this location soon and highly recommend for others to do shopping here.

This lululemon location never disappoints. The team is friendly, welcoming, and genuinely helpful. Nisa is a standout‚Äîso knowledgeable and always going the extra mile. An absolute pleasure to shop here.

I love Lululemon! The quality is amazing, and their leggings are my absolute favorite ‚Äî I buy them every time. They‚Äôre super comfortable, fit perfectly, and last a long time even with regular wear. The staff are always friendly and helpful, and the store has a calm, welcoming vibe. Definitely worth it!

Bad attitude. I came to return some item purchased online. been told that they are small scale store and recommend me to return by mail.  End up with letting me returned some, and keep asking "are they all you want to return, and refused to accept the left saying "i recommend you return the left items by mail, these are all i can do."‚Ä¶‚Ä¶ i understand she just want her work to be easy‚Ä¶ but i have to drive to another place to return the left.

I‚Äôve been pleased with the way they greet you and trying their best to help. The cashier answered all my questions and the manager was nice. It‚Äôs a good brand, I‚Äôm happy with the quality specially pants and skorts.

Very unpleasant experience. I usually dont write this, but cashier who helped me today seemed very unmotivated to work. Very awkard customer service. (Didnt even fold my clothes after purchase.)  It seems like i was having flea market quality customer service (even worse). The staff around change room was very helpful though. I would not go this location ever.

The other day, I visited Lululemon to buy some gifts for my family in Thailand. There, I met Kevin, a very kind and funny employee who greeted me warmly and made me feel welcomed. As I was searching for gifts, looking somewhat lost and confused with various thoughts running through my mind, Kevin approached me with friendly small talk and kindness. After narrowing down my preferences, he helped me find the item I wanted. When we realized it wasn't available at that location, Kevin went above and beyond by asking where I lived. He then found the closest store to my place that had the size and color of socks I wanted. Kevin is the best, and I highly recommend this location.

The store pop-up is amazing. I have been visiting this store since I live close by and been a lululemon fan. Today, I was trying the smooth spacer pull over hoodie.Rho, helped me to find the right size and she ordered it for me. The overall experience is amazing with a friendly and welcoming team.

I wish this pop up store will be permanent and not just a pop-up.

I usually enjoy shopping at Lululemon, but this experience was very upsetting.

My boyfriend was trying on clothes in the fitting room, and I briefly stepped inside only to hand him a jacket and help decide what he should try on first. There was nothing inappropriate happening.

Without any warning or verbal notice, an employee suddenly pulled the fitting room curtain fully open and told us that two people were not allowed inside. This was extremely embarrassing and felt like a complete violation of privacy.

If there is a policy, it should be communicated verbally and respectfully first, not by forcefully opening a curtain while customers are inside. The employee appeared to be the oldest staff member in the store, which made the lack of professionalism even more disappointing.

I hope Lululemon provides better training on customer privacy and respectful communication. This experience has negatively affected my impression of the brand.

This was a serious violation of privacy.
A staff member knocked on my fitting room curtain and opened it immediately without waiting for my response, while I was in the middle of changing.
Instead of apologizing, the staff member simply asked for my name and said nothing else. There was no acknowledgment of the mistake or how inappropriate the situation was.
When I came out of the fitting room, the same staff member avoided eye contact and continued chatting with others, as if nothing had happened.
I felt embarrassed, disrespected, and dismissed.
This should never happen in any retail environment, especially not in a store like Lululemon.

Today I went to exchange colour of the 3 items that was gifted to me. I said I am here to colour exchange these items if possible. He said sure then he scan my items and gave me a gift card I was confused and I mentioned again I only need to exchange. He said yes that‚Äôs how we do it. Then I was like okay, but then when he was scanning I noticed total price is lower, so I asked were they on sale items he said NO so I was like okay. He said again it‚Äôs the same thing you gave these 3 items with this card you go and get the colour you want. Then when it was all over I went to look at the prices of the items they were on sale, so I lost the value of my stuff if I knew they were on sale items would keep my stuff. I was so disappointed and frustrated so I left the store I didn‚Äôt want to talk to anybody. I should have been informed that these items were on sale if you want to keep them or this would be the value for me to put in a card for you. What is your choice.

UPDATE: Manager Stephanie called and apologized and they are sending me the correct item. Thank you!!

Ordered an item online for pick up, they put the wrong item in the bag. When I got home I noticed it‚Äôs not what I ordered. Called several times no answer so I can get the item I paid for. Disappointed.

I visited this store during Black Friday week and had a great experience. A young gentleman, I believe his name was Soroosh, was incredibly helpful and patient while I shopped for my husband. Everything about the mens section he knew very well, would definitely come again!

I give 5/5 to products : design, cut, material‚Ä¶fantastic.
But I give 1 to their online shopping services.

Imagine you buy something online , you see ‚Äú package ready for shipment‚Äù , next day :‚Äù shipped ‚Äú then after a week it says ‚Äú Undeliverable ‚Äú ????? So I contacted customer service which of course is a computerized conversation , and all I heard was : ‚Äú oh , that product was sold out ‚Äú

Ok, then how something that was NONEXISTENT in the first place was SHIPPED? And after one week UNDELIVERABLE??? Like the package dropped dead on the way to destination address?
Come on guys!!!!
I‚Äôve always supported lululemon as being Canadian, BC based company, but this ?!!! Extremely disappointed.

A few staff members made a mistake with my purchase, and it was a bit stressful at first. But Avalon the manager at Lululemon Park Royal, was truly amazing. She was so kind, understanding, and professional. She followed up with me and made sure everything was handled perfectly. I really appreciate her support and the way she cared. Thank you, Avalon ‚Äî you turned a stressful situation into a positive one.
üôèü•∞
